alert.note: Alert for Callaway (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 17 at 4:19AM CDT until June 17 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CALHOUN...JERSEY...ST. CHARLES...LINCOLN... MONTGOMERY...SOUTHEASTERN CALLAWAY...NORTHWESTERN FRANKLIN... NORTHEASTERN OSAGE...WARREN AND NORTHERN GASCONADE COUNTIES... At 419 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Hardin to near Fountain N` Lakes to 6 miles east of Big Spring, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Winfield, Hardin, Fountain N` Lakes, Chain of Rocks, Warrenton, St. Paul, Truesdale, Treloar, Marthasville, Innsbrook, St. Charles, Jerseyville, Dutzow, Grafton, Elsah, New Melle, Portage Des Sioux, Augusta, Orchard Farms, Kemper, Hazelwood, Bridgeton, Brighton, West Alton, Defiance and Weldon Spring Heights. This also includes Deutschheim Historic Site, Cuivre River State Park, Graham Cave State Park, First Missouri State Capitol Historic Site, and Pere Marquette State Park. This includes Interstate 70 in Missouri between exits 170 and 229. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in St Louis.
